_metadata.description: IPC (Indian Penal Code, 1860) to BNS (Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, 2023) mapping database
sources: Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India
The Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, 2023 (Act No. 45 of 2023)

107.notes: Abetment of an offense - Definition and scope remain similar

109.notes: Punishment of abetment if the act abetted is committed

120A.notes: Criminal conspiracy - Definition retained with similar scope

124A.notes: Sedition replaced with 'Acts endangering sovereignty, unity and integrity of India' - Narrower definition, requires tendency to incite violence or public disorder

144.notes: Joining unlawful assembly armed with deadly weapon

148.notes: Rioting armed with deadly weapon - Enhanced provisions

153A.notes: Promoting enmity between groups on grounds of religion, race, etc.

166.notes: Public servant disobeying law with intent to cause injury

168.notes: Public servant unlawfully engaging in trade

195.notes: Giving or fabricating false evidence to procure conviction

201.notes: Causing disappearance of evidence or giving false information

211.notes: False charge of offense made with intent to injure

224.notes: Resistance or obstruction to lawful apprehension

228A.notes: Disclosure of identity of victim of certain offenses - Protection enhanced

269.notes: Negligent act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life

270.notes: Malignant act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life

279.notes: Rash driving on public way - Penalties enhanced

295A.notes: Deliberate acts to outrage religious feelings

300.notes: Murder - Definition and exceptions similar to IPC

302.notes: Punishment for murder - Death or life imprisonment; enhanced for certain categories

304.notes: Culpable homicide not amounting to murder - Punishment structure retained

304A.notes: Death by negligence - Punishment enhanced, includes specific provisions for medical negligence

304B.notes: Dowry death - Minimum punishment increased to 7 years

306.notes: Abetment of suicide - Provisions remain similar

307.notes: Attempt to murder - Punishment structure similar, up to 10 years or life

320.notes: Grievous hurt - Eight types listed similar to IPC

323.notes: Punishment for voluntarily causing hurt - Up to 1 year or fine up to Rs 10,000

324.notes: Voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons - Up to 3 years

325.notes: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt - Up to 7 years and fine

326.notes: Grievous hurt by dangerous weapons - Up to 10 years and fine

354.notes: Assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage modesty - Punishment enhanced to 1-5 years

354B.notes: Assault with intent to disrobe woman - 3-7 years

354D.notes: Stalking - Punishment up to 3 years for first offense

359.notes: Kidnapping - Two types: from India and from lawful guardianship

363.notes: Punishment for kidnapping - Up to 7 years and fine

366.notes: Kidnapping woman to compel marriage - Up to 10 years and fine

370.notes: Trafficking of persons - Comprehensive provisions with enhanced punishment

375.notes: Rape - Definition expanded, marital rape exception modified (age raised to 18)

376.notes: Punishment for rape - Minimum 10 years, may extend to life; death for repeat offenders

376A.notes: Punishment for causing death or vegetative state - Minimum 20 years to death

376AB.notes: Rape of woman under 12 - Minimum 20 years, may extend to death

376D.notes: Gang rape - Minimum 20 years to life imprisonment

377.notes: Unnatural offenses - Consensual acts between adults decriminalized per Supreme Court; non-consensual acts covered under other sections

378.notes: Theft - Definition similar, value-based punishment tiers added

379.notes: Punishment for theft - Up to 3 years or fine or both

380.notes: Theft in dwelling house - Up to 7 years and fine

384.notes: Extortion - Punishment up to 3 years or fine or both

390.notes: Robbery - Definition includes theft with violence or threat

392.notes: Punishment for robbery - Up to 10 years and fine

395.notes: Dacoity - Five or more persons committing robbery

397.notes: Robbery or dacoity with attempt to cause death - Minimum 7 years

405.notes: Criminal breach of trust - Definition retained

406.notes: Punishment for criminal breach of trust - Up to 3 years or fine or both

409.notes: Criminal breach of trust by public servant - Up to 10 years and fine

415.notes: Cheating - Definition includes inducing delivery of property or consent

417.notes: Punishment for cheating - Up to 1 year or fine or both

420.notes: Cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property - Up to 7 years and fine; commonly invoked section for fraud cases

463.notes: Forgery - Making false document with intent to cause damage

465.notes: Punishment for forgery - Up to 2 years or fine or both

467.notes: Forgery of valuable security - Up to 10 years and fine

468.notes: Forgery for purpose of cheating - Up to 7 years and fine

494.notes: Bigamy - Marrying again during lifetime of spouse; up to 7 years

498A.notes: Cruelty by husband or relatives - Up to 3 years and fine

500.notes: Punishment for defamation - Up to 2 years or fine or both

503.notes: Criminal intimidation - Threat to cause injury

504.notes: Intentional insult to provoke breach of peace

506.notes: Criminal intimidation - Up to 2 years or fine; 7 years for death/grievous hurt threats

509.notes: Word, gesture or act intended to insult modesty of woman - Up to 3 years and fine

511.notes: Attempt to commit offenses punishable with imprisonment for life
